definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize

sentences.english: If you learn English parrot-fashion, you'll never know what English is.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只是死记硬背英语，你将永遥学不会英语。

sentences.english: English isn't just a list of English words.
sentences.chinese: 学习英语并非仅是死记一连串的单字。

sentences.english: That you look at , this writes down law is much more amusing than cramming up.
sentences.chinese: 你看，这个记法比死记硬背要有趣得多。

sentences.english: You can't make a full command of English words if you depend on mere mechanical memory.
sentences.chinese: 只靠死记单词是不能熟练掌握英语词汇的。

sentences.english: It is useless to learn grammatical rules by rote.
sentences.chinese: 死记文法规则是没有用的。

sentences.english: Rote memorization is an inefficient way to learn.
sentences.chinese: 在学习上，死记硬背是一种低效的方法。

sentences.english: A curriculum designed on traditional rote-learning methods.
sentences.chinese: 基于传统死记硬背学习方法制定的课程。

sentences.english: If you learn English parrot-fashion , you'll never know what English is.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只是死记硬背，你将永远学不会英语。

sentences.english: He always tries to cram as much information into his brain as possible during exam week.
sentences.chinese: 每逢考试周，他总是尽多地死记硬背。

sentences.english: Education in Asia is still too stifling, rote and high-pressured.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的教育还是很沉闷，靠死记硬背而且负担重。
不要死记硬背，而要活说活用。

sentences.english: Third, never cram for it without contexts.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要脱离上下文孤立地去死记硬背。

sentences.english: You will also see that this has nothing at all to do with learning fixed-phrase idioms by heart.
sentences.chinese: 你也会发现这与死记固定的英语习语毫不相关。

sentences.english: He's mugging up history for the exam.
sentences.chinese: 他正在死记历史以应付考试。

sentences.english: If you learn English parrot-fashion, you'll never know what English is.
sentences.chinese: 如果你只是死记硬背，你将永远学不会英语。

sentences.english: You need not memorize code, it is good to want divisional and can different type only.
sentences.chinese: 你不必去死记代码，只要会区分不同类型就好了。
